comment.author: 13639096@N06
comment._content:
What a beautiful photo of the organ!  This, of all the town halls I have seen, is the best, the most wonderfully designed.  I love its side alleys, its human scale, its beautiful galleries.  Is there a better town hall in Australia?  Sydney Town Hall is hard to beat.
(And then of course, there is the outside, in that lovely warm Hawkesbury sandstone.)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: A great looking and sounding instrument. I thought it was the same as the Powerhouse picture, but the chairs have moved and the console doors are open: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362678043/ Hear what it sounds like: www.youtube.com/watch?v=_FXoyr_FyFw

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: It is a jewel in Sydney's crown and was the largest Town Hall in the Empire when it was built.
